required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Life Context and Social Determinants of Health on Treatment Burden in Diabetes and Multiple Chronic Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this proposal is to pilot test two types of pre-visit planning, where clinical staff reviews charts and talks to patients before their doctors appointments, to reduce the burden of diabetes care on the patient without increasing the visit workload during busy primary care clinics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at completion of study, 4 months after last study visit
primary_outcome.description: patients reached by phone for PVP call after assigned to call; # patients recruited successfully who were eligible; # questions completed on the surveys; # calls made to each patient and to patients total per # patients reached and # patients enrolled; # patients who completed all surveys; qualitative interviews will discuss challenges, barriers, and other feasability concerns to scaling this pilot trial to a definitive multi-center trial

primary_outcome.time_frame: after each clinic visit, within 2 weeks; at end of study
primary_outcome.description: a short survey measuring PCPs perception of the visit's difficulty, hassle and effort; qualittive interviews with patients, providers and those conducting the intervention PVP calls

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Burden of Diabetes Care Questionnaire (TBQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated survey that measures patient self-assessment of chronic disease care burden; 13 items on a 5 point Likert scale, 13-65, higher score is worse

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Experience with Treatment and Self-Management (PETS) Questionnaire Medical Expenses Subsection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated survey that measures patient's self-assessed ability to handle financial aspects of chronic disease care; 5 items on a 5 point Likert scale, 5-25, higher score is worse

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated survey of patient experience with their healthcare; 6 items on a 7 point Likert scale, 6-42, higher score is better

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated measure of patient participation in their own healthcare; 13 items on a 4 point Likert scale, 13-52, higher score is better

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated survey on the patients perception of their ability to care for their diabetes; 8 items on a 5 point Likert scale, 8-40 higher score is worse

secondary_outcome.measure: SF-12, Short Form 12 questions Health Survey
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: a validated 12 question survey on patient's physical and mental health

secondary_outcome.measure: Discussion of social determinants of health (SDH) during clinic visit, self-reported
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after each clinic visit, within 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: a single question survey, self-reporting by the participant, if SDH were discussed between the doctor and the patient during the visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: change in A1c level from baseline to post-study, using values nearest to study start and end dates

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: systolic and diastolic blood pressure value pre and psot study, using measures closest to study start and end date, and area-under-the-curve for blood pressure in between.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index change from beginning of study to the end of the study, using most recent height available

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: validated survey on elements of physician job satisfaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Maslach Burnout Inventory Human Services Survey for Medical Personnel
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: change in symptom score, as measured by PHQ2 (0-6, higher is worse) or PHQ9 (0-27, higher is worse), as available, done within one month of study start and after visit by study end

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 4 months post visit
secondary_outcome.description: change in symptom score, as measured by GAD2 (0-6, higher is worse) or GAD7 (0-21, higher is worse), as available, done within one month of study start and after visit by study end

intervention.description: may experience a single additional phone call from clinic staff in addition to the standard clinic staff chart review, email and/or phone call prior to diabetes office visit
standard clinic staff chart review, email and/or phone call prior to diabetes office visit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients:
- patient at the UCD ACC family medicine residency clinic
- age 18+,
- has diabetes per Diabetes Registry (HealthyPlanet2020)
- PLUS at least one other chronic condition
- attends a primary care office visit (in-person or telehealth) during the study initial data collection period with a physician who is participating in the study
- speaks and writes English well enough to complete a written or oral survey
- consents to participate
PCPs:
-sees patients as a primary care physician at the study clinic site
Exclusion Criteria:
- does not meet inclusion criteria

patient_data.ipd_description: Plan to share anonymized or de-identified data per IRB approval to researchers at my institution.
